pullRequest.title: Service client implementation
pullRequest.bodyText:
-- Allows us to remove boiler plate code in every service which creates a retrofit client.
From :
new RestAdapter.Builder()
        .setEndpoint(orcaBaseUrl)
        .setClient(new Ok3Client(okHttpClientProvider.getClient(new DefaultServiceEndpoint("orca", orcaUrl))))
        .setConverter(new JacksonConverter(mapper))
        .setLog(new Slf4jRetrofitLogger(OrcaService.class))
        .setLogLevel(logLevel)
        .build()
        .create(OrcaService.class);

to:
retrofitServiceProvider.getService(OrcaService.class, new DefaultServiceEndpoint('orca','http://orca.net')`

-- Possibility of switching to other client/http engines if needed in the future.
-- Once every service moves to this impl, we can remove all the retrofit related dependencies from kork-web.

nodes.bodyText: these should all be implementation or runtimeOnly if this module doesn't expose a public interface

It will be interesting to see how often this method is needed in client code.
I wonder if we could define an interface something like ServiceClientCustomizer<B>, and let customizations happen via beans that implement that as needed so this doesn't have to happen at the service client creation call site.
Just a thought though

+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.

+ * limitations under the License.
+ *
+ */
+
+package com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.web.serviceclient;
+
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.config.ServiceEndpoint;
+
+/**
+ * Factory to build clients/builders that help to make remote http calls.
+ *
+ * @param <B> represents client builder type
+ */
+public interface ServiceClientFactory<B> {
+
+  /**
+   * Builds a concrete client capable of making HTTP calls.
+   *
+   * @param type client type
+   * @param serviceEndpoint endpoint configuration
+   * @param <T> type of client , usually a interface with all the remote method definitions.
+   * @return a implementation of the type of client given.
+   */
+  public <T> T create(Class<T> type, ServiceEndpoint serviceEndpoint);
+
+  /**
+   * Initializes and returns the underlying client builder implementation for further customizations
+   * as needed.
+   *
+   * @param type client type
+   * @param serviceEndpoint endpoint configuration
+   * @param <T> type of client , usually represents a interface with all the remote method
+   *     definitions.
+   * @return a client builder
+   */
+  public <T> B build(Class<T> type, ServiceEndpoint serviceEndpoint);

commit.message: fix(misc): allow customizable service client factories to be injected later

commit.message: fix(misc): allow customizable service client factories to be injected later

nodes.bodyText: I would also change this to getService.

commit.message: fix(misc): rename the module and explcitly callout retrofit service provider

nodes.bodyText: Probably change this to RetrofitServiceFactory too.

nodes.bodyText: Maybe this can just be called the RetrofitServiceFactory?
Under what context would we disable this?
